snippet: The tornado that struck El Reno on Friday had a record-breaking width of 2.6 miles, the National Weather Service said Tuesday.
abstract: National Weather Service says tornado that struck El Reno, Okla, had record-breaking width of 2.6 miles and was second top-of-the-scale EF5 tornado to hit Oklahoma City area in less than two weeks.
lead_paragraph: The tornado that struck El Reno on Friday had a record-breaking width of 2.6 miles, the National Weather Service said Tuesday.

headline.main: Oklahoma: Tornado Broke Record for Width
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma: Tornado Broke Record For Width
